Issues.Body:

common

### Is this a regression?

Yes

This error only occurs from only one page. All the others work correctly.

Issues.Title: HTML element remains disabled if FormControl is enabled
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Angular does not remove HTML disabled Attribute from input element when:

- input element is linked to formControl in disabled state
- user action causes that new instance of formControl is created (and replace the old one) in enabled state
- input element remains disabled (disabled attribure is not removed from HTML element)
(changing input element from enabled to disabled in this way works well)

Example:
For HTML template
`
<input [formControl]="testControl">
{{testControl.disabled}}
<button (click)="toggleDisable()">Toggle</button>

`

this toggle function cause the issue (after button click input remain disabled event if new form control is enabled):
`
 toggleDisable() {
    const newForm = new FormControl()
    newForm.setValue(this.testControl.value)
    if(this.testControl.disabled) {
      newForm.enable()
    } else  {
      newForm.disable()
    }
    this.testControl = newForm
  }
`

If I do not creaate new instance of form control (only modify the existing) - it work:
`
 toggleDisable() {
    if(this.testControl.disabled) {
      this.testControl.enable()
    } else  {
      this.testControl.disable()
    }
  }
`

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
textarea (or any other input element) keeps disabled atribute when the associate FormControl is enabled
`
<textarea _ngcontent-cyo-c120="" ng-reflect-form="[object Object]" disabled class="ng-untouched ng-dirty ng-valid"></textarea>
`
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular 12.2.2
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Chain elementStart/elementEnd instructions
Issues.Body:
Split up into two commits to make it easier to review:

1. **refactor(compiler): rework instruction generation logic for improved flexibility**
Previously the logic for generating chained instructions was somewhat rigid, because we had to collect all of the calls ahead of time and then call one of the chained instruction helpers. This doesn't work for something like `elementStart`, because we have to descend into other elements that could add to the chain.

These changes refactor the code so that we collect the list of instructions in a flat array and we do the chaining only once at the end when we have the entire instruction set for the code block.

The new approach has the advantage of being (almost) entirely configuration-based via the `CHAINABLE_INSTRUCTIONS` array and being more flexible in allowing us to chain instructions that span across elements.

2. **perf(compiler): chain element start/end instructions** 

In templates with several levels of nested nodes, it's common for several `elementStart`/`elementEnd` instructions to show up in a row which can be optimized away.

These changes add chaining support for `elementStart`, `elementEnd`, `elementContainerStart` and `elementContainerEnd` to shave off some bytes when possible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Chain elementStart/elementEnd instructions" (#44994)

Issues.Title: Angular13.1.2 works well in production mode but throws error in development mode
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

```js
// ...
            "development": {
              "buildOptimizer": false,
              "optimization": true, // if set it to `false`, app throws error
              "vendorChunk": true,
              "extractLicenses": false,
              "sourceMap": true,
              "namedChunks": true
            },
```

My project has been constructed on the basis of Angular2(beta) since 2016。 Now I prepare to upgrade it from Angular8 to Angular13. After updating angular and related npm packages, and adjusting so much code, the app works well! But only in production mode, which means I have to set "optimization" to `true`.

included in the tab order even though they are not visible, fix
such behavior by applying `display: none` to the closed sidenav
so that its elements become non-interactable

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): close aio search results when they lose focus
Issues.Body:
currently if a user tries to navigate via keyboard, once the are
presented with search results, the search results panel remains
present and can potentially hide most of the content on the page,
in such case keyboard navigation will be severly hindered and
the only option for the user would be to go back to the seach input
text and clear its value, fix such inconvenience by closing the
results panel as soon as an element outside the main header and
the results gets focus

Issues.Title: `FatalDiagnosticError` is being throw instead of it being converted to a`ts.Diagnostic`
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] build ### Is this a regression? Unknown. I am in the process of updating from Angular 10.x (where things build fine) to 13.x (where things are breaking), but it's unclear if this is a regression. ### Description I have two Angular library projects in a monorepo. Project B depends on Project A. Both are pretty small. When attempting to build both, Project A builds successfully but Project B fails with the following error: ``` Schema validation failed with the following errors: Data path "/error" must be string. ``` It's unclear what schema the error is referring to and it's also unclear what `Data path "/error"` is referring to. If "schema" refers to `angular.json` in this context, it's unclear what `Data path "/error"` is referring to since an "error" key isn't documented for `angular.json`. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Clone the [angular-cli-build-bug](https://gitlab.com/service-work/is-loading/-/tree/angular-cli-build-bug) branch of my `service-work/is-loading` repo. The repo contains a [`.devcontainer.json` file](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/create-dev-container) which can be used to quickly setup the dev environment. 1. run `yarn install` 2. (optional) run `yarn test`. Tests should all pass. 3. run `yarn build`. The `@service-work/is-loading` project should build successfully but the `@service-work/scroll-position` library should fail with the following message: ``` Schema validation failed with the following errors: Data path "/error" must be string. ``` Note that the `@service-work/scroll-position` package depends on the `@service-work/is-loading` package. However, the only file in `@service-work/scroll-position` that actually imports from `@service-work/is-loading` is the `projects/scroll-position/src/scroll-position/module/directive/scroll-position.directive.ts` file. If you comment out the `@service-work/is-loading` import in that file, as well as the related code, then the `@service-work/scroll-position` file builds without error. It's unclear if there's something wrong in my code which is preventing the project from building (in which case the provided error message should be improved to make clear what the problem is) or if there's a bug with the build script. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

Schema validation failed with the following errors:
  Data path "/error" must be string.

Issues.Title: Custom form controls extending AbstractControl beyond the default ones
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Lately I have been struggling with reusing form areas. I read all about CVA and sub forms with inputs etc... They seemed to miss something. At the beginning I was sure CVA would be the best fit which almost was the case. The problem started when I needed to render parts of the form in tabs yet all of them created together one form. For the sake of the explanation let's take a simple date range component as an example. The control has built in validation to make sure the `from` field isn't greater than the `to` field. At some point I loaded an invalid form (wrong date range) due to business requirements to the form yet the form was valid. The reason was the CVA component included the validation yet it wasn't rendered. That brought me to think the missing part was the decoupling of form logic from the UI. In regular reactive forms it works well - in the TS you add controls and validators and only bind it to the html which doesn't necessarily need to be rendered. In the CVA or sub forms "land" the form and UI is coupled together.
The feature request I thought is why not create a class called `DateRangeFormControl` extending `AbstractControl`. The whole form logic with validations will be there while the UI will be in the component.
This allows us a few benefits:
1. Decoupled logic and UI - will solve the CVA validation problem from above
2. Possible reusability with different components
3. Still easily apply through `formControlName` and use inside say a form group in the parent

### Proposed solution

Having the possibility to create custom form controls and restrict components to accept specific custom control types in `formControlName`/ `formControl` or something similar.
For example if it was implemented:
1. A component called `date-range.component.ts` exists.
2. Adding another file near it called `date-range.form.ts` which contains:
```ts
export class DateRangeFormControl extends AbstractContol {
  // Implements DateRange specific logic here - model + validation + maybe custom functions
}
```
3. `DateRangeComponent` would implement CVA (or another interface?) and declare it only accepts `DateRangeFormControl` somehow so it can safely use its functions and structure.
4. In the parent component the ts declaration will be:
```ts
form = new FormGroup({
  one: new FormControl('...'),
  two: new DateRangeFormControl({from: ..., to: ...})
})
```
5. In the parent HTML the declaration will be:
```html
<app-date-range formControlName/customFormControlName="two"></app-date-range>
```

There are still a few things which require more thought - How to restrict to certain controls in a component? Can we use the same form directives? Is CVA the correct interface here (as we want to decouple the form logic yet CVA requires functions like `setValue` to be implemented on the component)? Probably using form group inside the custom form component is required yet how to achieve it as it should act as a form control to the outside? And I believe many more... 

### Alternatives considered

1. Regular CVA while hiding with display none instead of ngif
2. Pass form as input from parent
3. Create form in child and add it with `ControlContainer` injection
4. Create form in child and add it through parent view child

All of the above suffer from drawbacks - the proposed solution seems to fix them all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Custom form controls extending AbstractControl beyond the default ones" (#44983)

Issues.Title: Local serving does not work following upgrade to Angular 13
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description I have two Angular applications in my project, a main app, then a much smaller app for testing our internal UI component library. It's also an NX monorepo. I've just upgraded to Angular 13 (using `nx migrate` and the prod builds and main application serve are all working as expected. Unfortunately, the small UI component app is not working with serve. Previously our script command in package.json used to use the `--base-href` flag, but now in Angular 13 this has been removed and gives message: > 'baseHref' is not found in schema So I have removed the `--base-href` flag from the command in package.json. I've tried adding the exact same config to the angular.json file in the root of the project, like this: ``` "build": { "options": { "baseHref": "/component-guide", // rest of config } } ``` But this has not worked. The actual serve command completes successfully, but when I try to hit my app in the browser at URL `localhost/component-guide` it just goes crazy and reloads like every 10 milliseconds (it is just reloading like crazy, the favicon is actually flashing, never seen anything like it) I also tried adding the same `baseHref` config to the project.json file in the apps/component-guide folder (and having it in both angular.json and project,json individually and at the same time). ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction I'm sorry, but there isn't a _minimal reproduction_ - my project is enormous and contains not just one but two separate applications. I can provide any additional information, or examples from my config files, but I cannot share the project as it is a commercial product. ## 🔥 Exception or Error Application reloads hundreds of times per second ## 🌍 Your Environment

Issues.Title: Allow proxy in ng-serve to proxy to local files
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [X] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

Expanding on issue #6773

Since webpack 5.0.0 and module federation, pugins for Angular apps are now much more straightforward to develop.

However, serving these with `ng serve` is cumbersome because of the lack of static file serving support (it's common to want to load the plugins from the same webroot as the app).

Webpack devServer **does** support this via:

```
static: {
      directory: path.join(__dirname, 'whatever'),
      publicPath: '/whatever'
},
```

However, when supplied via `extraWebpackConfig` this configuration does not apply (presumably because it is overwritten by angular's own configuration).

### Describe the solution you'd like

Can we please have support for adding static serve paths to the dev server?

### Describe alternatives you've considered

It is of course possible to proxy requests through to a different server and have that serve the webroot, but this is clumsy and should be unnecessary.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow proxy in ng-serve to proxy to local files" (#22656)

Issues.Title: error TS5024: Compiler option 'files' requires a value of type Array
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [X] build
- [X] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

Typescript supports semantics which specify if `include`, `exclude`, `files` and `types` (possibly others) will **replace** or **merge** when extending a base `tsconfig.json` file.

e.g this will blank the array that was set at a higher level:

```
"exclude": {
    "mode": "replace",
    "values": []
  }
```

However, angular-cli complains: "error TS5024: Compiler option 'files' requires a value of type Array"

### Describe the solution you'd like

Please add support for this semantic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "error TS5024: Compiler option 'files' requires a value of type Array" (#22664)

Issues.Title: Version 13.2.2 breaks production build when using dynamic imports
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 13.2.1 ### Description When running a production build with version 13.2.2, it fails with an error after chunk generation completes. This relates to using a dynamic import of a json file. The error is: `An unhandled exception occurred: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'name')` (see below for extended error) ng serve does not have this problem. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction - A dynamic import of a json file: ```import(`../../../../../assets/animations/${this.animation}.json`).then(animation => {``` - causes the error (`Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'name')` - Because in function [`extractIdentifiedModule`](https://github.com/xz64/license-webpack-plugin/commit/55dd3f87c8f19338e45affec6f2271f75a0167ad#diff-1ceba7b65a6b2be17f78ef52a1cda37a99ce008020dabce02f3414141eb5261bR62-R81) the `directory` and `packageJson` are undefined The problem is caused by license-webpack-plugin@4.0.1, specifically the changes in commit https://github.com/xz64/license-webpack-plugin/commit/55dd3f87c8f19338e45affec6f2271f75a0167ad Also reported as bug to `license-webpack-plugin`: https://github.com/xz64/license-webpack-plugin/issues/119 ## 🔥 Exception or Error Error

<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.14.18`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​01418)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.14.17...v0.14.18)

-   Add the `--mangle-cache=` feature ([#​1977](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/1977))

    This release adds a cache API for the newly-released `--mangle-props=` feature. When enabled, all mangled property renamings are recorded in the cache during the initial build. Subsequent builds reuse the renamings stored in the cache and add additional renamings for any newly-added properties. This has a few consequences:

    -   You can customize what mangled properties are renamed to by editing the cache before passing it to esbuild (the cache is a map of the original name to the mangled name).

    -   The cache serves as a list of all properties that were mangled. You can easily scan it to see if there are any unexpected property renamings.

    -   You can disable mangling for individual properties by setting the renamed value to `false` instead of to a string. This is similar to the `--reserve-props=` setting but on a per-property basis.

    -   You can ensure consistent renaming between builds (e.g. a main-thread file and a web worker, or a library and a plugin). Without this feature, each build would do an independent renaming operation and the mangled property names likely wouldn't be consistent.

    Here's how to use it:

    -   CLI

        ```sh
        $ esbuild example.ts --mangle-props=_$ --mangle-cache=cache.json
        ```

    -   JS API

        ```js
        let result = await esbuild.build({
          entryPoints: ['example.ts'],
          mangleProps: /_$/,
          mangleCache: {
            customRenaming_: '__c',
            disabledRenaming_: false,
          },
        })
        let updatedMangleCache = result.mangleCache
        ```

    -   Go API

        ```go
        result := api.Build(api.BuildOptions{
          EntryPoints: []string{"example.ts"},
          MangleProps: "_$",
          MangleCache: map[string]interface{}{
            "customRenaming_":   "__c",
            "disabledRenaming_": false,
          },
        })
        updatedMangleCache := result.MangleCache
        ```

    The above code would do something like the following:

    ```js
    // Original code
    x = {
      customRenaming_: 1,
      disabledRenaming_: 2,
      otherProp_: 3,
    }

    // Generated code
    x = {
      __c: 1,
      disabledRenaming_: 2,
      a: 3
    };

    // Updated mangle cache
    {
      "customRenaming_": "__c",
      "disabledRenaming_": false,
      "otherProp_": "a"
    }
    ```

-   Add `opera` and `ie` as possible target environments

    You can now target [Opera](https://www.opera.com/) and/or [Internet Explorer](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/internet-explorer.aspx) using the `--target=` setting. For example, `--target=opera45,ie9` targets Opera 45 and Internet Explorer 9. This change does not add any additional features to esbuild's code transformation pipeline to transform newer syntax so that it works in Internet Explorer. It just adds information about what features are supported in these browsers to esbuild's internal feature compatibility table.

-   Minify `typeof x !== 'undefined'` to `typeof x < 'u'`

    This release introduces a small improvement for code that does a lot of `typeof` checks against `undefined`:

    ```js
    // Original code
    y = typeof x !== 'undefined';

    // Old output (with --minify)
    y=typeof x!="undefined";

    // New output (with --minify)
    y=typeof x<"u";
    ```

    This transformation is only active when minification is enabled, and is disabled if the language target is set lower than ES2020 or if Internet Explorer is set as a target environment. Before ES2020, implementations were allowed to return non-standard values from the `typeof` operator for a few objects. Internet Explorer took advantage of this to sometimes return the string `'unknown'` instead of `'undefined'`. But this has been removed from the specification and Internet Explorer was the only engine to do this, so this minification is valid for code that does not need to target Internet Explorer.

<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 🚀 Feature request

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [x] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [x] test
- [x] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [x] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

I have a mono repository and I want to split my `angular.json` into separate files.

So that I can have something like this:

```
{
  "version": 2,
  "projects": {
    "module-auth": "packages/module/auth",
    "module-core": "packages/module/core",
    "ui-button": "packages/ui/button"
  }
}
```

**My current `angular.json` file has 119 lines of code which is 100 % going to be unmaintainable in the future.** Keep in mind that what I have is a pet project and it is nowhere near thousands of lines of code that production applications might have.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Make the JSON configuration 1:1 with what NX does: https://nx.dev/configuration/projectjson#workspace-json

Issues.Title: Branch coverage data is incorrect after upgrading to Angular 13
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [X] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 12 ### Description The coverage produced when running `ng test --code-coverage` is incorrect, it is missing branches that were previously counted. This applies to `if` that do not have an `else`: these used to be counted as two branches, and they are now counted as one. This artificially increases branch coverage. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Starting from a minimal reproduction repository (`ng new`), make the following changes: 1. Add `src/foo.ts`. Note that this function contains two branches to cover: the if, and the (non-explicitly written) else. ``` export function foo(n: number) { if (n % 2 === 0) { console.log('hello'); } } ``` 2. Add `src/foo.spec.ts`: ``` import { foo } from './foo'; describe('test', () => { it('test', () => { foo(2); }); }); ``` 3. Restrict the test suite to run only `foo.spec.ts` in `src/test.ts`: ``` const context = require.context('./', true, /foo\.spec\.ts$/); ``` 4. Launch the tests with code coverage: `npx ng test --code-coverage` 5. The output reports full coverage, of only one branch: ``` =============================== Coverage summary =============================== Statements : 100% ( 2/2 ) Branches : 100% ( 1/1 ) Functions : 100% ( 1/1 ) Lines : 100% ( 2/2 ) ``` For comparison, downgrading to Angular 12 and to Typescript 4.3.5 results in the correct coverage report, which is: ``` =============================== Coverage summary =============================== Statements : 100% ( 5/5 ) Branches : 50% ( 1/2 ) Functions : 100% ( 1/1 ) Lines : 100% ( 5/5 ) ``` ## 🌍 Your Environment Everything comes from the default app when running `ng new` 

Angular CLI: 13.2.2
Node: 16.13.2
Package Manager: npm 8.1.2
OS: linux x64

Angular: 13.2.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1302.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.2.2
@angular-devkit/core            13.2.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.2.2
@angular/cli                    13.2.2
@schematics/angular             13.2.2
rxjs                            7.5.2
typescript                      4.5.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Branch coverage data is incorrect after upgrading to Angular 13" (#22652)

Issues.Title: New app generation requires git
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... 11, although was also running into bug with `ng new` there - https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/21326 ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... When I run `ng new ` on a system without git installed, it fails. I don't think git should be a requirement for a new app generation (I don't believe it's a documented requirement). New app generation should also be deterministic, not relying on a git repo that could change without notice. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction In a docker container: ``` FROM centos:7 USER root RUN yum update -y RUN echo "Installing NVM" && \ curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash && \ export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm" && \ [ -s "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" RUN echo "Installing Node" && \ nvm install 16 && \ nvm alias default 16 && \ nvm use 16 && \ mkdir -pv /opt/node && \ cp -rf ${HOME}/.nvm/versions/node/v*/* /opt/node && \ export PATH="/opt/node/bin:${PATH}" RUN echo "Installing Angular" && \ npm install -g @angular/cli@12.2.16 && \ RUN echo "Upgrading npm." && \ npm install -g npm@8.4.0 RUN node --version && \ npm --version && \ ng --version ENTRYPOINT [ "sleep" ] CMD [ "86400" ] ``` open up a bash session in the container, and run `ng new mytestapp`: ``` $ ng new mytestapp ? Would you like to add Angular routing? Yes ? Which stylesheet format would you like to use? Issues.Title: Adding linter to ng serve
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

<!-- ✍️--> Hey guys, I am well aware of issues https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/3269 and https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/3269 but those are over a few years old and I think this feature is still kinda missing.

Purpose of feature is to add `ng lint` functionality to watch cycle of `ng serve` and `ng build --watch` commands. Right now, I can set up linter in IDE, but it only lints file I am currently working on.

### Describe the solution you'd like

<!-- ✍️-->  It would be great to have lint functionality, that is already there, enabled in watch commands of angular CLI. I can, of course, set up another watcher, but purpose of CLI should be to provide pleasant developer experience :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adding linter to ng serve" (#22648)

Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [X] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? This was working in Angular <=10 because the "ora" package was not used to create a beautiful spinner in the console stream. ### Description The ora spinner is using **process.stderr** as default stream which causes some test runners to fail the entire test execution because there was something written to the stdErr output. This behavior can be changed to use **process.stdout** instead which should be enough for this kind of logging. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction using e.g. karma 6.3.12 ng test any-library-you-want-to ## 🔥 Exception or Error There is no actual issue, but this is what the spinner is used for in the test command: 
\ Generating browser application bundles (phase: building)...
√ Browser application bundle generation complete.
I'm sure the spinner is used in other commands, too. But for the most uses cases (e.g. local development) writing to strErr stream is not relevant except for testing strategies. An issue in the stdErr stream could cause test runners to declare the run as failed even all tests succeeded. ## 🌍 Your Environment 
Angular CLI: 11.2.0
Node: 14.18.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.2.0

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.18
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.18
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.18
@schematics/angular             11.2.18
@schematics/update              0.1102.0
ng-packagr                      11.2.0
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.8
**Anything else relevant?** This affects all versions of Angular 11+
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@angular-devkit/build-angular using ora spinner with default "stdErr" stream can break test environments" (#22642)

Issues.Title: Production build breaks Bootstrap collapse panel close animation
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes - it was working before Angular (I was making an upgrade from 9 to 13 - on Angular 9 it works as intended). ### Description When using production build minification and optimization of bootstrap.js file breaks collapse panel close animation (it simply does not show). ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Create a new Angular 13 project, install Bootstrap . Make sure that "node_modules/bootstrap/dist/js/bootstrap.bundle.js" or any other bootrap.js file is included in build.scripts of angular.json file. Create a collapse panel in any method from Bootstrap: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.1/components/collapse/ Build app in production mode: "npm run build -- --configuration production" Run the app. Open and close panel - there will be no closing animation. When you build app in non production mode everything works as expected. ## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 13.2.1
Node: 14.18.2
Package Manager: npm 8.3.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 13.2.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Issues.Title: build: flip build script to bazel
Issues.Body:
This flips the cli build to use bazel, replacing the legacy build script with the bazel one.

Looking for careful feedback on the second commit where I stop running bazel clean before a release build. This is something I originally copied over from the angular project, but I can no longer reproduce the issue locally. I think that my use of `config_setting`s and `select`s with the release artifacts causes the build to correctly stamp artifacts without the need for a clean... but someone who understands this better should take a look.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: flip build script to bazel" (#22638)

Issues.Title: An unhandled exception occurred: NOT SUPPORTED: keyword "id", use "$id" for schema ID
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) I have an Angular project which I just upgrade from 12 to 13.2 In this project I have my own schematics. In the branch with new angular 13.2 I start to get error when I execute my schematics. When I go back to the master branch with angular version 12 schematics work as should. **The schematics that I'm executed:** ``` /versions/node/v16.10.0/bin/node" "/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng" generate @sing/component ofir ``` **The error:** ``` An unhandled exception occurred: NOT SUPPORTED: keyword "id", use "$id" for schema ID See "/private/var/folders/64/rqq3mpzn6tx_8bgq7l7_md700000gp/T/ng-qCJE17/angular-errors.log" for further details. ``` **Log of file angular-errors.log:** ``` [error] Error: NOT SUPPORTED: keyword "id", use "$id" for schema ID at Object.code (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/vocabularies/core/id.js:6:15) at keywordCode (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/validate/index.js:454:13) at /Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/validate/index.js:222:17 at CodeGen.code (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/codegen/index.js:439:13) at CodeGen.block (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/codegen/index.js:568:18) at iterateKeywords (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/validate/index.js:219:9) at groupKeywords (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/validate/index.js:208:13) at /Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/validate/index.js:192:13 at CodeGen.code (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/codegen/index.js:439:13) at CodeGen.block (/Users/ofirf 1/dev/singularity-ui/node_modules/ajv/dist/compile/codegen/index.js:568:18) ``` - [X] generate ### Is this a regression? Yes ## 🔥 Exception or Error

Issues.Title: bug(VirtualScroll): Safari 15.4 breaks virtual scroll; unable to scroll the list
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Safari 15.4 is the next version of Safari and is currently in beta. You can use it on macOS by installing Safari Technology Preview 15.4. You can use it on iOS by installing iOS 15.4 Beta.

CDK virtual scroll lists will no longer scroll on 15.4 although they work fine on 15.3 and previous versions.

_This is very arguably an issue in WebKit 15.4 and not something to be fixed in the CDK itself. I wanted to at least help the CDK maintainers and others who might begin running into this issue have some awareness as to what's going on. I have opened an issue with WebKit [here](https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=236260). If there are no changes to be made to the CDK, feel free to close this issue if desired._

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://material.angular.io/cdk/scrolling/examples on Safari 15.4.
  - Safari 15.4 is the next version of Safari and is currently in beta. You can use it on macOS by installing Safari Technology Preview 15.4. You can use it on iOS by installing iOS 15.4 Beta.
2. When you try scrolling the examples you'll see the virtual list will not scroll at all.
  - When using macOS, you'll see the vertical scrollbar no longer appears. You can't scroll using a mouse scroll wheel either.
  - When using iOS, touch-based scrolling doesn't work.

If you open the same examples on Safari 15.3 (current stable version), the lists scroll and the vertical scrollbar is present on macOS.


### Expected Behavior

Virtual scroll lists can scroll on Safari 15.4 like they do on Safari 15.3.

### Actual Behavior

Virtual scroll lists do not scroll on Safari 15.4.

### Environment

(This is inferred from the StackBlitz examples for the examples at https://material.angular.io/cdk/scrolling/examples .)

- Angular: 13.0.3
- CDK/Material: 13.2.0
- Browser(s): Safari 15.4
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS, iOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(VirtualScroll): Safari 15.4 breaks virtual scroll; unable to scroll the list" (#24373)

Issues.Title: bug(Theming Angular Material): Custom typography not applied to standard typography levels in mat.core-theme() or all-component-themes()
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Tried to change the font-family so that e.g. body-1 everywhere has font family Arial.
But it only changed the font-family in mat components, not outside in normal divs.

```
$my-typography: mat.define-typography-config(
  $font-family: 'Arial',
);
$my-theme: mat.define-light-theme((
  typography: $my-typography,
  color: (
    primary: $dicey-primary,
    accent: $dicey-accent,
    warn: $dicey-warn,
  ))
);
@include mat.all-component-themes($my-theme);
```

Similar problem was reported here, but not solved: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/23683#issue-1015421891

-----------------------

It works when I do it with all-component-typographies:

```
$my-typography: mat.define-typography-config(
  $font-family: 'Arial',
);
@include mat.all-component-typographies($my-typography);
```


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Add custom theme with typography
2.  See if body tag font-family changes


### Expected Behavior

Bodys font family changes to custom font family

### Actual Behavior

The body font family is standard Roboto

### Environment

- Angular: 13.1.2
- CDK/Material: 13.1.1
- Browser(s): Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Theming Angular Material): Custom typography not applied to standard typography levels in mat.core-theme() or all-component-themes()" (#24370)

Issues.Title: MatPolygon changing options with next() not working
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I am using @angular/google-maps and all of material components in fact, but I am experiencing this strange behavior with a GoogleMap MatPolygon. I am successfully adding polygons on the maps and I am able to add polygonClick events to them, but then in the polygonClickHandler I pass the polygon object and I am able to pass a new value to polygon._options - BehaviorSubject, but the result of this is not consistent. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't.

### Reproduction

HTML Template:
<ng-container *ngFor="let subject of subjectArr | async">
        <map-polygon (polygonClick)="onPolyClicked($event, subject[1], polygon)" *ngFor="let object of subject[0]"
            [paths]="object" [options]="subject[1]"></map-polygon>
    </ng-container>

And the component typescipt:
onPolyClicked(event: any, object: any, polygon: any) {
    const options = {
      strokeColor: '#ffffff',
      strokeOpacity: 1,
      strokeWeight: 3,
      fillColor: '#ffffff',
      fillOpacity: 1,
    };
    polygon._options.next({ ...polygon._options, ...options });
 
  }

### Expected Behavior

I expect the polygon to change options when clicked.

### Actual Behavior

Sometimes it does change and more often it doesn't.

### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):

Issues.Title: feat(material/radio): provide `mat-radio-container-no-side-margin` class as it's done for mat-checkbox
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

When setting up radio buttons without label, the label container still adds a padding, making the radio-button wider than neccessary.

A css class `mat-radio-container-no-side-margin` could easily be added in the same way as done for [`mat-checkbox`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/02d6e7d77ae77feae7d52c929b0dff74f6624c1a/src/material/checkbox/checkbox.html#L3), allowing use to get rid of the padding when there is no label.

### Use Case

I'm implementing a SCSS theming framework for corporate design rules for Angular Material components.
Thus I need to provide styles for both cases, radiobutton with and without labels.

One of the use cases of radiobuttons without labels is having them in table cells. They would be "labelled" by the column header.

Reproduction: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-erstgu?file=src/app/app.component.css
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(material/radio): provide `mat-radio-container-no-side-margin` class as it's done for mat-checkbox" (#24347)

Issues.Title: feat(paginator): Add option to allow reset pageIndex to 0 on pageSize changes
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Add config option that allows to control the value of pageIndex on pageSize changes. For example with a directive input  like `[resetPageIndexOnPageSizeChange]="false | true"`

### Use Case

While the current implementation (ensure first element is still shown when page size changes) makes perfect sense from a logical and technical point of view it is a constant point of misunderstanding with our customers as well as their users.

In every project this topic comes up multiple times. Every customer so far has reported this as a bug, even after 
we explained the behavior prior.

In addition we have A / B tested the default behavior vs resetting to first page and in 100% of cases when feedback was given it was in regards to the default behavior. We have tried to add in app explanations but it didn't really help. Users just complained less but they still didn't understand the behavior.

It saddens us that the less logical and technically correct option is the one of choice, but customers want what customers want :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(paginator): Add option to allow reset pageIndex to 0 on pageSize changes" (#24345)
